alert.note: Alert for Creek; Okmulgee (Oklahoma) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued May 13 at 11:43AM CDT until May 13 at 3:45PM CDT by NWS Tulsa
info.description: The National Weather Service in Tulsa has issued a * Flash Flood Warning for... Southwestern Creek County in northeastern Oklahoma... Northwestern Okmulgee County in northeastern Oklahoma... * Until 345 PM CDT. * At 1142 AM CDT, Doppler radar indicated a persistent band of training thunderstorms producing heavy rain across the warned area. Radar estimated rain rates between 1 and 2 inches per hour. Flash flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly. HAZARD...Flash flooding caused by thunderstorms. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Flooding of small creeks and streams, urban areas, highways, streets and underpasses as well as other drainage and low lying areas. * Some locations that may experience flooding include... Okmulgee... Beggs... Slick... Preston... Okmulgee State Park... Liberty... Hectorville... FLASH FLOOD...RADAR INDICATED
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
